Title: Accounting Staff
Company: Geodis Vietnam Co. Ltd.
Location: Bluesky Office Building, No. 01 Bach Dang, Ward 2, Tan Binh District, HCMC, Bluesky Office Building, No. 01 Bach Dang, Ward 2, Tan Binh District, HCMC
Job Description:
GEODIS is a Supply Chain Operator ranking among the top companies in its field in Europe and the World. GEODIS, which is part of SNCF Logistics, which in turn is a business line of the SNCF Group, is the number one Transport and Logistics operator in France and ranked number four in Europe. The international reach includes a direct presence in 67 countries and a global network spanning over 120 countries.
With its five lines of business (Supply Chain Optimization, Freight Forwarding, Contract Logistics, Distribution & Express and Road Transport), GEODIS manages its customers Supply Chain by providing end-to-end solutions enabled by our people, our infrastructure, processes and systems.

We are looking for candidates for the position of Accountant to join our Finance team in HCM:

RESPONSIBILITIES:
AR Function:
- Daily check bank statement and collection to make sure the outstanding AR invoices shall be cleared timely and correctly in the accounting system.
- Having smooth and professional collaboration with Sales team with regards to dunning of overdue debts and other AR dispute/complaint from the customer.
- Coordinate with the Accounting team to monitor and record the up-to-date data of customer in the system for both operation and accounting in conformance with signed contract and related documents else.
- Assist Credit Control Specialist to manage well bad debt issue of the company, directly implement the bad debt provision in the accounting system in accordance with corporate instruction for month-end closing purpose.
- Prepare and complete the reporting package related to AR aspect on daily/weekly/monthly and yearly basis that should be accurate and in time per timeline of Corporate and direct supervision by Credit Control Specialist.
- Create GID code for new customers.
- Recording/perform the AR collection activities on Getpaid tool application weekly.
- Billing to GSCO, DHO, RHO for recharged cost, cross-check HR’s recharged cost vs AX data
Monitor VAT invoicing / Do billing to customer/ Reconcile compliant no with e-invoice number:
- Follow up and ensure all collections shall be matched with outstanding invoices in time and correctly.
- Ensure for correct issuance of VAT invoice based on its nature and deliver to customers in timely manner together with internal record, evidence/reference for delivery to customer, etc.
- Support and coordinate with Ops for adjustment, cancellation and replacement of VAT invoice in conformance with Tax and Accounting 's regulations.
Job Requirements:
REQUIREMENTS:
- University degree in Finance & Accounting or equivalent.
- Minimum 2 years’ experience in Finance & accounting, preferably in logistics and forwarding
- Experience in global forwarding & logistics companies is a plus
- Considerable knowledge of accounting book-keeping and financial record-keeping methods related to manual and financial record-keeping systems, accounting principles and practices, Vietnamese tax law, administrative procedures and systems such as word processing, managing files and records.
- Perform detailed numerical work with speed and accuracy and to detect record-keeping and data entry errors.
- Good computer skills, familiarity with Microsoft office, especially Excel skill.
- Pro-active, interested in and able to find solutions, able to work within a team.
- Hands-on attitude towards work, flexible. Strong communication skills.
- Ability to set and follow up clear objectives.
- Able to plan and organize own daily and future activities.
- Can make decisions and both keep them and be able to re-evaluate.
- Ability to work independently as well as in a (virtual) team environment.
- A pragmatic approach to work and the ability to be flexible when needed.
- Assertive & Honesty, well organized with interest to develop structures, methods and tools.
- Able to handle multiple assignments.
- Quality focus, willingness to stay on top of up-to-date developments.

WHY JOIN US:

- Competitive salary + attractive bonus

- During 2 months probation time: 100% salary, Annual leave applied, BVI Health Insurance

- 13th month salary, Yearly performance bonus, Annual salary review

- Bonus for successfully referring new employees, Buddy program for Newcomers

- BVI Health Insurance, Annual health checks

- Full Social insurance, Health insurance and Unemployment insurance

- Internal & External Training courses

- Annual company trip, Gifts on special occasions

- 12 - 16 days off annual leave

- Professional global working environment.

Working place: Bluesky Office Building, No.1 Bach Dang, Ward 2, Tan Binh District, HCMC.

Title: Personal Assistant to Head of Elementary (Vietnamese)
Company: EMASI International Bilingual Schools
Location: Trường EMASI Nam Long, Emasi Nam Long (District 7, HCMC) & Emasi Van Phuc (Thu Duc City, HCMC)
Job Description:
1. GENERAL DESCRIPTION
The Personal Assistant to the Head of School – Head of Elementary is an administrative support role responsible for ensuring smooth operations across academic, administrative, internal, and external affairs of the school. In addition to directly supporting the Head of School – Head of Elementary, the Personal Assistant acts as the main liaison between departments, assists with the organization of assessments, receives and processes information from educational authorities, drafts documents and reports, and coordinates the planning and execution of school events.

2. RESPONSIBILITIES
• Translate documents, letters, and materials; provide interpretation in meetings as required by the Head of School – Head of Elementary.
• Perform administrative tasks related to the management and training of teaching staff.
• Schedule appointments, prepare meeting agendas, workshops, attend meetings, and take minutes for the Head of School – Head of Elementary.
• Consolidate school-wide plans, including input from departments such as Administration, Admissions, Vietnamese Curriculum, and International/ Integrated Curriculum.
• Communicate directives from the Head of School – Head of Elementary to relevant departments.
• Compile, analyze, and summarize reports and data from various departments for submission to the Head of School – Head of Elementary upon request.
• Ensure timely and accurate provision of information and documentation required by the Head of School – Head of Elementary.
• Receive requests and arrange appointments for the Head of School – Head of Elementary with parents, departments, and external partners.
• Coordinate interdepartmental collaboration as assigned; monitor progress and report updates to the Head of School – Head of Elementary.
• Accompany the Head of School – Head of Elementary in meetings with domestic and international partners when required.
• Support the development, maintenance, and expansion of relationships with governmental authorities and external organizations.
• Assist in the implementation and enforcement of school policies and procedures.
• Serve as a key liaison between the Vietnamese Curriculum and the International/Integrated Curriculum at EMASI.
• Operate the ISAMS system to support communications with parents, generate academic reports, extract data, and assist in preparing termly student progress reports.
• Assist in the preparation and consolidation of tests and examinations; coordinate periodic student assessments.
• Coordinate with the Academic Office/ Student Affair Officer in receiving official documents, directives, and circulars from the Department of Education; prepare and submit required reports.
• Collaborate with relevant departments to plan, update, and organize school events, trips and internal programs.
• Assist in arranging and reallocating staff (teachers, student assistants) as directed by the Head of School – Head of Elementary.
• Organize and manage records, documents, files, and reports related to school operations.
• Perform other tasks as assigned by the Head of School – Head of Elementary.
Job Requirements:
Education:
• Bachelor’s degree required, preferably in Education or Educational Management.
• English proficiency equivalent to TOEIC 700 or higher.
• Proficiency in office software; preference for candidates with a Type B computer skills certificate or equivalent.
Experience:
• Not mandatory.
• Preference will be given to candidates with experience in administrative roles in the education sector or similar positions.
Skills:
• Strong task and time management skills.
• Information processing and problem-solving abilities.
• Teamwork, communication, and interdepartmental coordination skills.
• Event planning and strategic scheduling skills.

Personal Characteristics:
• Honest, detail-oriented, and highly responsible.
• Flexible, proactive, and capable of working independently under pressure.
• Committed to long-term professional development in the field of education.
The candidate is expected to demonstrate professional ethics, solid subject knowledge, and a positive working attitude. They should be ready to collaborate and engage closely with students, parents, and the school community in a bilingual educational environment. These qualities are reflected in the following values:
Attitudes
• Self-motivated (I want to do it)
• Self-challenged (I can do it)
• Always striving for perfection (I’ll do it best)
Aptitudes
• Critical thinking
• Human sensible
• Physically fit

Title: Universal Banker - Direct Sales (HCMC)
Company: United Overseas Bank (Vietnam) Limited (UOB)
Location: Sun Wah Tower, 115 Nguyen Hue Boulevard, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam, The Central Plaza, 17 Le Duan, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
Job Description:
About UOB
United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia, Thailand and Vietnam, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values – Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.

About the Department
We design and provide products and services that empower our customers to enjoy greater banking convenience while they extract more value from their money. In particular, we are focused on promoting and developing healthy saving and investment practices across generations.

Responsibilities
• Generate sales revenue at designated location or assigned geographical coverage area.
• Proficient in selling to mass market customers and is deployed in mass market locations.
• Meets/exceeds sales established target.
• Follows laid out sales and service processes to establish contact with prospective customers, understands needs and sells them appropriate products offered by the bank.
• Continue to seek and maintain product and service knowledge.
• Build and maintain new and existing customer relationships.
• Gathers information as needed about customers, markets, and competition.
• Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding, its clients, and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules, and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behaviour, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing, and reporting control issues with transparency.
• Other tasks as assigned by the supervisor and the management.
Job Requirements:
Requirements
• College/University graduates with major in finance, banking, economics, business administration, marketing or other related areas are preferred.
• Demonstrated sales experience and result orientation.
• Strong sales sense with good selling and interpersonal skills
• High energy level, enthusiast to hunt new customer during Roadshow events.

Be a part of UOB Family
UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application.
Apply now and make a difference.

Title: Specialist 2, CNC Machining Operations (shift-based position)
Company: Công Ty TNHH II-VI Việt Nam
Location: No. 36, Street 4th VSIP, VSIP, Binh Hoa Ward, Thuan An City, Binh Duong Province 820000, Vietnam, Số 36, đường số 4, Khu công nghiệp VSIP I, Thành phố Thuận An, Tỉnh Bình Dương
Job Description:
BASIC FUNCTION OF THE JOB:

- Machining specialist 2 is responsible for setting up, programming, operating, and optimizing CNC machines to manufacture precision components. They also support process improvements, troubleshooting, and ensuring products meet high-quality standards in production environments.
• Set up CNC machines (milling, grinding, EDMs) according to specifications and blueprints.
• Select appropriate tools, fixtures, and machine parameters.
• Operate CNC equipment to machine parts with high accuracy.
• Inspect in-process parts to ensure conformance to specifications using calipers, micrometers, CMMs, and other precision measuring tools.
• Adjust feeds, speeds, and tooling paths as necessary to optimize production.

- Provide technical expertise and experience in the field of practical precision machining and manufacturing such as multi-milling, EDM, precision grinding, finishing processes, CNC machining operation for technical problem solving, process troubleshooting…
Job Requirements:
Educational background: Bachelor’s degree in manufacturing technology, Manufacturing engineering or equivalent specialization.
Experience:
• 2+ years’ experience in CNC machining, precision machining and CAD/CAM/CNC techniques.
• CAD & CAM software: Proficient in CAD/ CAM Master CAM, EDM machine, Laser machine programming …
• Knowledge of CNC precision machining, advanced manufacturing processes, materials, manufacturing facilities, including equipment handling, facilities.
• Experience with documentation and ERP system.

Title: Business Controlling Assistant Manager
Company: B. Braun
Location: Thanh Oai Industrial Complex Thanh Oai Dist, Hanoi Vietnam, Thanh Oai Industrial Complex, Thanh Oai Dist, Hanoi, Vietnam
Job Description:
B. Braun Vietnam is now looking for Business Controlling Assistant Manager, directly report to CFO and lead a team of 4 subordinates. This position is the main core job of Lead Controlling department with the below job responsibilities:

1) Production & Investment Control:
1.1 Prepare and manage Local and Regional/Global reporting package for Production report (monthly, quarterly, annually) to ensure the reports are submitted with high accuracy and compliance with VAS, IFRS in timely manner.
1.2 Calculate, analyze profitability of production options to consult and propose to Management.
1.3 Review investment proposals for approval and make annual investment assessment
1.4 Monitor budget spending, provide assessment of cost deviations, support to define saving measures and evaluate change control effectiveness.
1.5 Advise Production Team on process & record of production cost to comply with guidelines of Global/ Regional

2) Budgeting, Planning, Analysis and Reporting:
Manage budget, forecast P&L consolidation including:
2.1 Prepare budgeting, production cost development plan following Global planning cycle.
2.2 Conduct monthly Divisional result analysis & controlling (price effect, profitability, contribution margin, Sales & Marketing expenses...).
2.3 Prepare budgeting and manage expense development of central functions.
2.4. Complete periodical reports as per requirements of Local/Regional/Global."
3) Closing book activities:
3.1 Run cycles after reviewing all expenses, identify P&L gap between accounting systems if any and propose solutions.
3.2 Transfer and release P&L on global finance system
4) General Controlling:
4.1 Act as contact point to receive and verify Transfer Price for selling prices and purchasing prices.
4.2 Manage cost impact of new selling prices and purchasing prices for all types of goods.
4.3 Lead team to run actual costing following global timeline.
4.4 Manage the verification and ensure sales incentive, production incentive being paid following schemes.
4.5 Ensure controlling procedures and processes are implemented properly across functionsAct as Subject
4.6 Matter Expert of Controlling Module
5) Team Management and Other tasks:
5.1 Lead, manage and develop a Controlling team
Consolidate, provide and clarify financial data, documents to Audit (Hard closed, EOY, Notes for FS)
5.2 Complete all reports for IT audits (SOD Conflict, Pending Items)
5.3 Join Project team for commercial parts
5.4 Other ad-hoc requirement
Job Requirements:
- Graduated from university with major in Finance/Accounting/Economics with good understanding for VAS, IFRS
- At least 5 years of experience in budgeting, cost planning and controlling, investment control in foreign manufacturing companies
- Experience with management accounting.
- Experience with SAP system, Robotic process automation (RPA), Power BI dashboard is preferred
- Excellent in Excel advance
- Fluently in speaking and writing English skill
- Excellent in analytical problem solving and decision skills
- Strong leadership and communication skills with the ability to develop, manage and inspire others

Title: QC Officer (Final Control)
Company: B. Braun
Location: Thanh Oai Industrial Complex Thanh Oai Dist, Hanoi Vietnam, Thanh Oai Industrial Complex, Thanh Oai Dist, Hanoi, Vietnam
Job Description:
B. Braun Vietnam factory is now seeking for QC Officer to work at Thanh Oai factory, Hanoi with the main purpose to ensure product quality before releasing for delivery and control defect if it happens during checking by visual and function; control corrective & preventive action of production, pre-investigate the customer complaint.

Detailed job tasks:
1) Leading Final QC team to conduct inspection for finished goods, investigate the failed sample (OOS handling) then release the goods in SAP system.
- Arrange team members to conduct the test acc to TM & TS
- Handle deviation during inspection
- Release the finished goods in SAP system
- Block the affected goods in SAP system as well as adhere respective sticker in physical goods.
2) Responsible in Validation activity & Test Request at Final QC team and early update Risk & Opportunities identification and evaluation for the activities at Final QC team & meet requirement in ISO 17025.
- Arrange team member to conduct testing acc to validation plan
- Notify to related dept the testing result.
- Follow up with OOS / DIR / trackwise if any abnormal finding during testing
- Create / upload / verify report accordingly
3) Monthly Report Final QC field and update Data Integrity Governance Plan ("DIGP") accordingly.
- Pre-condition the complaint samples when received
- Conduct pre-investigation for the CC/PC together with production
- Release task to related person from production for details of investigation
4) SOP / TM / WI creation, revision, training, evaluate the training effectiveness & conduct verify / re-verify Test method according to Validation Test Method Report from BBM.
- Create / revise / update TM / TS / WI when got information from superior
- Supervise, coach & mentor team members
- Verify the test method & qualify the staff
5) Other tasks
- Investment needed machine / equipment for final control team / stationary for QC team
- Cooperate with QM / supplier for calibration equipment of final control team
- Monthly Report Final QC field and update DIGP accordingly.
Job Requirements:
- Bachelor degree with technical background.
- 3 years working experience in QC in manufacturing companies. Good knowledge in production processing preferred.
- Sound knowledge and experience with 7 QC tools.
- Good communication and English skills.
- Logical thinking /Analytical mindset/System mindset.
